definition: to study assiduously and tirelessly (idiom)/see also 頭懸梁，錐刺股|头悬梁，锥刺股[tou2 xuan2 liang2 , zhui1 ci4 gu3]
to hang or suspend/to worry/public announcement/unresolved/baseless/without foundation
Liang Dynasty (502-557)/Later Liang Dynasty (907-923)/surname Liang
variant of 梁[liang2]
roof beam/beam (structure)/bridge
(onom.) whoosh
thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder

thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions
lit. with his head attached to a beam and stabbing his thigh with an awl (idiom)/fig. to study assiduously and tirelessly
pinyin: tou2 xuan2 liang2 , zhui1 ci4 gu3

definition: lit. to pierce the wall to steal a light (idiom)/fig. to study diligently in the face of hardship
lit. to hang one's books on cow horns (idiom)/fig. to be diligent in one's studies
to burn the midnight oil (idiom); to work continuously night and day
to start practicing at the first crow of the cock (idiom)/to be diligent in one's studies
lit. the leather binding (of the bamboo scroll) has broken three times/fig. to study diligently
lit. the snow piles up at Cheng Yi's door (idiom)/fig. deep reverence for one's master
to make an effort/to push for sth/to work hard
lit. not even peek at the garden/fig. to be absorbed in one's studies (idiom)
see 磨杵成針|磨杵成针[mo2 chu3 cheng2 zhen1]
to be strongly determined to succeed (idiom)
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
to make a determined effort
to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task/to study diligently
to study hard/assiduous
to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
